title: I need to identify this font sans sherif - Art deco, can you help me ?
author: Louis XIV

comments.content: Can't find a perfect match that could fit at the same time both /S with horizontal terminals and /R disproportional bowl... As alternative, I suggest [URW++ Signal](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205216/http:/www.youworkforthem.com/font/T1052/signal), used for French highways and road signs. I like also [Saa](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/urw/saa).

Arboria Bold comes close, but the S is off:  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeotones/arboria/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205216/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeotones/arboria/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/typeotones/arboria/")

Another possibility, found looking for a different ID:  
 [http://www.grillitype.com/typefaces/gt-walsheim](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205216/http:/www.grillitype.com/typefaces/gt-walsheim "http://www.grillitype.com/typefaces/gt-walsheim")
Apparantly one of the f’s has been shot …

The main thing that is distinctive is the \_R\_, which is found in a few fonts like Arboria Bold -- already suggested by Kevin -- GT Walsheim -- already suggested by Riccardo -- and Neutra Display [http://www.identifont.com/find?font=Neutra+Display&q=Go](http://web.archive.org/web/20150414205216/http:/www.identifont.com/find?font=Neutra+Display&q=Go "http://www.identifont.com/find?font=Neutra+Display&q=Go") The other letters are pretty common, including \_S\_ which is similar to Helvetica, Chalet, Newhouse, Nimbus, Pragmatica, Arial etc.  
perhaps the closest out of the box is GT Walsheim which hs both a similar \_R\_ and a somewhat similar \_S\_.  
Don
